rules_in_order: Only consider features whose depends_on entries are all complete
Prefer features that unblock the most remaining incomplete features
Prefer security, access-control, and data-integrity work over convenience work
Use file order as the final tie-breaker

features.name: Create folder storage schema
features.description: Add first-class folder persistence and dashboard-to-folder linkage.
features.why_it_matters: Folders are the foundation for organizing dashboards and later folder-level permissions.
requirements: Create folders table scoped by organization
Support optional parent folder for hierarchy
Add dashboards.folder_id and sort_order columns
steps: Update backend migrations for folders table and new dashboard columns
Add indexes for folder lookup and ordering
Run migration tests and fix any schema assumptions
acceptance_criteria: Migrations run without errors on a clean database
folders table includes org scope, parent_id, sort_order, and audit fields
dashboards can store nullable folder_id and sort_order

features.name: Add folder backend CRUD endpoints
features.description: Implement folder create/list/get/update/delete APIs with org scoping.
features.why_it_matters: Folder APIs are required before frontend folder management can ship.
requirements: Endpoints for POST/GET/PUT/DELETE folder resources
Read allowed for org members, write restricted to admin/editor
Responses include folder metadata and organization_id
steps: Add folder models in backend/internal/models
Create folder handler in backend/internal/handlers
Register routes in backend/cmd/api/main.go
acceptance_criteria: Folder CRUD endpoints respond with expected status codes
Viewer role cannot create/update/delete folders
Folder operations are restricted to the active organization

features.name: Add folder handler tests
features.description: Cover folder API behavior with focused backend tests.
features.why_it_matters: Folder + RBAC changes need guardrails to prevent regressions.
requirements: Success tests for create/list/get/update/delete
Forbidden tests for viewer write attempts
Cross-org isolation tests
steps: Add/extend backend/internal/handlers folder tests
Use seeded org memberships for role scenarios
Verify JSON payload shape and status codes
acceptance_criteria: Folder handler tests pass locally
Role and org isolation behavior is validated

features.name: Add frontend folder types and API client
features.description: Create TypeScript folder models and HTTP helpers for folder endpoints.
features.why_it_matters: Frontend folder UI should use typed API access, matching project patterns.
requirements: Add folder interfaces/enums in frontend/src/types
Add CRUD functions in frontend/src/api
Normalize API errors to existing error-handling style
steps: Create frontend/src/types/folder.ts
Create frontend/src/api/folders.ts
Add unit tests for API request/response behavior
acceptance_criteria: Folder API module compiles under strict TS
API tests validate method, URL, and auth header handling
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/api

features.name: Render dashboards grouped by folders
features.description: Show folder sections in dashboard listing and place unassigned dashboards in root.
features.why_it_matters: Users need visible folder structure before managing permissions.
requirements: List folders with their dashboards in Dashboards view
Show explicit section for dashboards without folder
Keep responsive behavior on desktop and mobile
steps: Fetch folders alongside dashboards in dashboards view/composable
Render grouped layout in dashboard list component
Add view-level tests for grouping behavior
acceptance_criteria: Dashboards appear under correct folder groups
Unassigned dashboards appear under a root/unfiled section
Existing dashboard interactions remain functional
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/components src/views

features.name: Add folder create/edit/delete controls
features.description: Provide folder management actions from the dashboard listing UI.
features.why_it_matters: Admins/editors need a direct way to maintain folder structure.
requirements: Add folder create modal/form
Add folder rename and delete actions
Respect role restrictions from backend responses
steps: Create folder modal components or inline forms
Wire actions to folder API client
Show concise success and error states
acceptance_criteria: Admin/editor can create, rename, and delete folders
Viewer sees read-only behavior with no destructive controls
UI refreshes correctly after each operation
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/components src/views

features.name: Allow moving dashboards between folders
features.description: Add dashboard placement controls to move dashboards across folders and root.
features.why_it_matters: Foldering is incomplete without quick reassignment of dashboards.
requirements: Expose folder picker when editing dashboard metadata
Support moving dashboard back to unfiled/root
Persist and reflect folder change immediately
steps: Add folder selector to dashboard edit flow
Send dashboard update with folder_id via API
Refresh grouped list after successful move
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard can be moved to any visible folder
Dashboard can be moved back to root/unfiled
Grouping updates without full page reload
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/components src/views

features.name: Create user groups and resource permission schema
features.description: Add database tables for org user groups and per-resource ACL entries.
features.why_it_matters: Object-level dashboard/folder access requires explicit principals and grants.
requirements: Add user_groups table scoped to organization
Add user_group_memberships table
Add resource_permissions table for folder/dashboard grants
steps: Extend backend migrations with group and permission tables
Add constraints for principal type and permission level
Add indexes for org_id, resource lookup, and principal lookup
acceptance_criteria: Group and ACL tables exist with valid constraints
Migrations succeed on clean DB
Schema supports user and group principals

features.name: Add backend user group CRUD endpoints
features.description: Implement organization-scoped group management APIs.
features.why_it_matters: Groups are needed to grant folder/dashboard access to teams.
requirements: POST/GET/PUT/DELETE /api/orgs/{id}/groups
Admin-only write operations
Consistent JSON error payloads
steps: Add group models and request structs
Implement group handler CRUD methods
Register group routes in API router
acceptance_criteria: Admins can manage groups
Non-admin members cannot modify groups
Group list is org-scoped

features.name: Add group membership endpoints
features.description: Allow admins to add/remove organization members in groups.
features.why_it_matters: Permissions must be assignable to a dynamic set of users.
requirements: List group members
Add organization member to a group
Remove member from a group
steps: Implement group membership handler methods
Validate target users belong to organization
Add route registration and response tests
acceptance_criteria: Admin can manage group members
Duplicate membership is prevented
Cross-org user assignment is rejected

features.name: Implement effective permission evaluation service
features.description: Create a backend service to resolve user access for folder/dashboard resources.
features.why_it_matters: All protected reads and writes need a single, testable authorization rule source.
requirements: Resolve permissions from direct user grants and group grants
Include org role fallback (admin/editor/viewer)
Support actions view, edit, and admin
steps: Add authorization service/helper package
Implement lookup queries for principal grants
Define deterministic precedence rules
acceptance_criteria: Service returns expected permission for direct and group grants
Org admins retain full access
Unknown resources/principals fail closed

features.name: Enforce permissions in folder and dashboard handlers
features.description: Wire effective permission checks into folder/dashboard API operations.
features.why_it_matters: RBAC is only useful when every resource endpoint enforces it consistently.
requirements: Filter list endpoints to resources user can view
Require edit/admin for mutations
Return 403 for unauthorized access attempts
steps: Integrate authz service into dashboard and folder handlers
Apply checks for list/get/create/update/delete
Update panel operations to respect dashboard permissions
acceptance_criteria: Users only see dashboards/folders they can view
Unauthorized writes are blocked with 403
Admin/editor workflows still function

features.name: Add folder/dashboard permission management endpoints
features.description: Expose APIs for admins to view and update ACL entries per resource.
features.why_it_matters: Permission changes must be configurable from the org UI.
requirements: Read ACL entries for a folder or dashboard
Replace ACL entries atomically for a resource
Validate principal belongs to same organization
steps: Implement permission handler methods
Add routes for folder and dashboard permissions
Persist ACL updates in resource_permissions table
acceptance_criteria: Admins can list and update ACL entries
Invalid principal/resource combinations are rejected
Updates affect effective permission resolution

features.name: Add RBAC permission matrix tests
features.description: Add backend tests for direct grants, group grants, and org role fallbacks.
features.why_it_matters: Complex ACL behavior needs matrix-style coverage to prevent security regressions.
requirements: Test viewer/editor/admin paths
Test group-based access grant and revoke
Test folder/dashboard unauthorized access returns 403
steps: Add/extend authz service tests
Add handler integration tests for forbidden and allowed flows
Keep test fixtures organization-isolated
acceptance_criteria: RBAC matrix tests pass reliably
Regression scenarios are covered for key actions

features.name: Add frontend groups and ACL API modules
features.description: Create frontend types and API clients for groups, memberships, and ACL resources.
features.why_it_matters: Organization settings UI needs typed API access for RBAC management.
requirements: Define TS types for groups, memberships, and permission entries
Implement API functions for group and ACL endpoints
Add API tests for request details and error handling
steps: Add type files under frontend/src/types
Add API modules under frontend/src/api
Add vitest coverage for new API modules
acceptance_criteria: Type-check passes with no unused/any issues
API tests validate endpoint paths and auth headers
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/api

features.name: Add user groups management section in organization settings
features.description: Expose group CRUD and membership management in org settings page.
features.why_it_matters: Org admins need an in-product place to define and maintain groups.
requirements: List groups in organization settings
Create/rename/delete groups
Add/remove organization members in each group
steps: Add groups panel to OrganizationSettings.vue
Wire form actions to groups API
Show clear empty/loading/error states
acceptance_criteria: Admin can manage groups and memberships from UI
Viewer/editor cannot access destructive group controls
UI updates after each group action
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views

features.name: Add folder permission editor UI
features.description: Enable admins to configure folder-level ACL entries for users and groups.
features.why_it_matters: Folder access rules must be configurable where folders are managed.
requirements: Show current folder ACL entries
Allow add/remove/update for user and group principals
Persist ACL updates through permission API
steps: Add folder permissions modal or side panel
Load org users/groups for principal pickers
Submit full ACL replacement payload
acceptance_criteria: Admin can edit folder permissions in UI
Permission changes persist after reload
Invalid entries surface actionable error messages
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/components src/views

features.name: Add dashboard permission editor UI
features.description: Enable admins to configure dashboard-level ACL entries.
features.why_it_matters: Teams often need dashboard exceptions within shared folders.
requirements: Show ACL editor from dashboard details/edit flow
Support user/group principals with view/edit/admin levels
Persist changes via dashboard permissions endpoint
steps: Add dashboard permissions UI control
Reuse ACL editor patterns from folder permissions
Update dashboard views after ACL save
acceptance_criteria: Admin can manage dashboard ACLs
ACL state loads and saves correctly
Permission errors are shown without breaking page state
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/components src/views

features.name: Apply permission-aware filtering and forbidden UX
features.description: Hide inaccessible folders/dashboards in lists and handle denied deep links gracefully.
features.why_it_matters: UI must match backend enforcement so users only see resources they can access.
requirements: List views only render resources returned by permission-filtered APIs
Dashboard detail route shows clear forbidden state on 403
No stale unauthorized resources remain after permission change
steps: Update dashboard/folder loading flows to respect filtered data
Handle 403 responses with concise forbidden UI
Add tests for denied navigation behavior
acceptance_criteria: Unauthorized dashboards/folders are not shown
Direct navigation to forbidden resources is handled cleanly
UI refresh reflects permission revocations
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views

features.name: Add frontend organization SSO API module
features.description: Create frontend API wrappers for Google and Microsoft org SSO config endpoints.
features.why_it_matters: Organization settings UI needs typed access to existing backend SSO config APIs.
requirements: Get and update Google SSO config
Get and update Microsoft SSO config
Consistent error normalization
steps: Add SSO types in frontend/src/types
Add API functions in frontend/src/api
Add API tests for both providers
acceptance_criteria: SSO API module passes strict type-checking
Tests verify endpoint paths and payloads
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/api

features.name: Add SSO configuration section in organization settings
features.description: Allow org admins to configure Google and Microsoft SSO credentials from UI.
features.why_it_matters: SSO setup should be managed by org admins without editing backend env or DB manually.
requirements: Add Google config form (client id, client secret, enabled)
Add Microsoft config form (tenant id, client id, client secret, enabled)
Restrict edit controls to org admins
steps: Add SSO section/cards to OrganizationSettings.vue
Load existing provider configs on page load
Submit provider-specific updates and show save feedback
acceptance_criteria: Admin can load and save Google and Microsoft SSO settings
Non-admin users can view but not modify SSO controls
Errors are shown with concise actionable messages
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views

features.name: Add SSO settings UI tests
features.description: Cover SSO configuration forms and role-based editing behavior with frontend tests.
features.why_it_matters: Org security configuration needs stable and verifiable UI behavior.
requirements: Test load/save paths for Google and Microsoft cards
Test admin-only editing restrictions
Test API error rendering
steps: Add OrganizationSettings SSO-focused test cases
Mock SSO API responses for success and failure
Validate button states and form submission payloads
acceptance_criteria: SSO UI tests pass consistently
Critical admin/non-admin behavior is covered
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views/OrganizationSettings.spec.ts
